newsitem.title: UK: Cathay Pacific sets cargo records in '96.
newsitem.headline: Cathay Pacific sets cargo records in '96.

text.p: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd set records for freight carried and for its available freight capacity last year, the airline said in a statement.

During 1996, Cathay Pacific carried 568,147 tonnes of freight which represented an increase of 6.9 percent on the year before. Available tonne kilometres rose 10.1 percent to ten million helped by an increase in Cathay's fleet during 1996 to 59 aircraft, the airline said.
This growth was part of a $2.4 billion fleet replacement programme which saw Cathay Pacific's Lockheed Tristar L-10/11s phased out and replaced with Airbus and Boeing aircraft.
"We carry over half of our cargo in the bellies of our passenger aircraft so the increased capacity has been welcome," said deputy managing director of the airline, Simon Heale.

Cathay Pacific is currently embarking on the second half of its multi-billion dollar programme of aircraft acquisitions. Seven Boeing 777-300s, an A330-300 and six A340-300s are scheduled for delivery by 1999.
There are also 25 outstanding options worth U.S.six billion dollars, it added in the statement.

"The opening of the new Hong Kong airport, with its two runways and 24 hour operations will provide substantial opportunity for increased slot availability and we will be ready to take advantage of these slots," said Heale. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
